intro: Covellia dasycarpa, commonly known as the woolly-fruited Covellia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its dense, hairy foliage and spherical, woody fruits that remain attached to the plant for an extended period. Covellia dasycarpa typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique morphology makes it a notable species in the study of South African flora.
